author: RStoddart
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

When attempting to sign a Script with Set-AuthenticodeSignature 
using the 
**PS C:\Scripts\SignScript>** Set-AuthenticodeSignature -FilePath C:\Scripts\SignScript\* -Certificate $Cert -IncludeChain "All" -TimeStampServer 'https://ca.signfiles.com/tsa/get.aspx'
**Error:** _Set-AuthenticodeSignature : Cannot sign code. The TimeStamp server URL must be fully qualified, and in the format http://<server 
url>...._

(URL does verify and work in the **http:**// variant)

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

The command should accept and use the HTTPS: ssl protocol request as it does with the HTTP: protocol. 
I speculate that the code that validates the input, does not accept https: as valid option. 

Security teams are all SSL(TLS) happy and would demand anything going over network be SSL (TLS) encrypted.
title: Feature Request: Set-AuthenticodeSignature -TimeStampServer support HTTPS
